1.content:
Setting: The Digital World

Guilmon and Renamon, along with the other Tamers Digimon, have returned to the Digital world where they were born. Since then they have discovered that, while they can talk to their human companions, and their partners can visit, the Digimon are no longer able to return to the Human world. While disappointing both sides have realized it's not so bad as there is plenty more to explore in the Digital world than the Human world.

It's been several years since the D-Reapers defeat, and the Digimon have matured somewhat. Guilmon, while still the happy little dino he's always been, has gained a new level of intelligence that could be considered comparable to a teenager. Renamon meanwhile has stayed almost the same, but new feelings of affection for Guilmon, something the dino has yet to notice, have her confused every time she's near him. As such, the pair have been traveling separately for some time, yet both have little idea of just what awaits them further down their paths....

==========

Choice 1: Guilmon and Renamon meet by chance at a ruined city, deep in the Digital Jungle.

Choice 2: Guilmon and Renamon stumble across a highly advanced city devoid of any creatures.

Choice 3: Guilmon's path takes him to a beautiful valley hidden deep in the mountains.

Choice 4: Renamon's path takes her to a beautiful sparkling beach.

Choice 5: Free choice.
1.title: Let's Begin....

choices: Suddenly a fireball burns down the tree
11.content:
Renamon groans pushing aside bushes "Why did Guilmon have to run off like that? Sure he had to run off in the middle of the night"
============================
Let me explain this first. *Pauses story*.
Last night Renamon and Guilmon made a campout.
Renamon still was silently asleep.
But then Guilmon stomach was growling.
He tried to wake Renamon up but he failed
So he walked off to find some food but lost his way.
Then in the morning Renamon woke up to find the digital dinosaur to be gone.
Thus leading Renamon to find him which is right now. *Plays story*
================================================
Lush overgrown plants were everywhere.
Renamon had trouble finding a pathway which got block by plants.
"Diamond Storm!" Diamonds went everywhere cutting the plants
Soon Renamon created her own path
"Phew" Renamon sighed
Suddenly one of Renamon diamonds cut a tree in half causing it to fall.
"Huh" Renamon lifted her head up
Renamon wouldn't have time to dodge it she would be crushed in a matter of seconds...
11.title: A mistake

choices: Someone captures Renamon in the middle of the night.
111.content:
The tree gets burn to a crisp before it can touch Renamon.
Renamon inched away from the burnt tree
Then she saw Guilmon emerge from another path
"Guilmon!" Renamon screamed
She ran towards Guilmon and hugged him.
They stood there just hugging each over for a couple of minutes.
Guilmon blushed "I never knew how soft your fur was Renamon."
Renamon replied with a giggle.
Then they separated the hug.
"Where have you been?" Renamon asked
"Oh last night I found this abandoned city with a whole a lot of food." Guilmon replied
Then Guilmon look down and found a whole bunch of cuts and bruises on Renamon
"Woah" Guilmon gasped "You can barely stand let me carry to the abandoned city i was talking about."
Then Guilmon put Renamon in his arms and carried her to the city.
When they arrived it was like a ghost town no one was there.
The city was in perfect shape though.
Renamon sniffed the air "Something doesn't seem right here." She growled
"Don't worry the digimon probably went to collect food" Guilmon said quietly
His voice was calm but uncertain.
Guilmon entered a house with Renamon still in his arms.
The house was like any normal house.
A living room, bathroom and bedroom only one though.
Guilmon entered the bedroom and set her down on a bed big enough for 2 people or digimon.
Guilmon sat next to the lying digital fox and sighed.
Renamon layed sideways showing where most of her wounds are at.
Guilmon crawled on top of Renamon and started licking her wounds with his 3-inch lizard tounge
Renamon quivered in delight and said "What are you doing Guilmon?"
Guilmon stopped licking for a moment and said "If i lick your wounds they should heal faster"
Then he went back to licking
Renamon blushed and said "It feels good keep doing it"
It continued for hours and eventually the digital fox fell asleep as well as Guilmon.
111.title: Their Paths Meet

1111.content:
"Yawn" Renamon woke up
First thing she noticed was Guilmon fell asleep on top of her.
His head right on her chest fur.
"Guilmon wake up." Renamon whispered
She kept poking him.
Until his eyes open.
He got off of her.
"Sorry bout that but your fur is really soft." Guilmon yawned
Renamon stretched on the bed spreading her legs and arms as wide as she could
Guilmon watched her and said "Your wounds are looking better.".
Renamon had a feeling he wasn't looking at her wounds.
But she only replied "Yeah good as new."
Guilmon grinned and went outside.
"Wonder why people left the city." Guilmon thought
Renamon came up behind him.
"What now?" Renamon asked
"Why don't we see if there is any food."
They walked to a abandoned store with still some food in it
"Guilmon I really think this place is suspicious."
"Your right. No ones here but theres fresh food everyday."
Suddenly Renamons ears perked up
"Someones here." Renamon whispered
"Show yourself! You coward!" Guilmon growled
They heard footsteps behind the counter
"Stay here Renamon. I'll protect you."
Guilmon slowly moved towards the counter and out came a two digimon called BlackAgumon and Veemon.....
1111.title: Is this place abandoned or not?

choices: Renamon kisses Guilmon to wake him up
Some digimon come to heal Guilmon
11112.content:
"Well...well you found us." Veemon snickered
"Thats too bad we were having so much fun watching you two" BlackAgumon laughed evilly
"What do you mean watching us?" Guilmon growled
"We would love to sit and chat but we must destroy you!" BlackAgumon and Veemon laughed
"Huh.." Guilmon said
"VeeHeadButt!"
Veemon hit Guilmon right in the gut.
"Renamon Run! Guilmon moaned
Renamon telported
She hated to do this but she had to trust him.
She telported to a tree.
"You want it come and get it!"
"Pepper Breath!"
Guilmon quickly dodge it!
"RockBreaker!" Guilmon screamed
He it exactly on BlackAgumons head
"Ow..dammit! BlackAgumon tripped
"I'll teach you you bastard" Veemon cursed
He jumped behind Guilmon and grabbed his tail
He chucked Guilmon out of the store into a building.
The building started collapsing onto Guilmon.
"Guilmon noo" Renamon screamed
The building buried the Guilmon
" Hmph" BlackAgumon recovered his senses "Now where is the other one."
"There she is!" Veemon pointed "VeeHeadButt"
"Diamond Storm!" Renamon cried
Veemon and BlackAgumon moaned
The sharp diamonds piercing them.
Each second got worse and worse until..
They turned into nothing.
Renamon jumped out of the tree.
She leaned against the tree her heart beating.
Holding her chest like that was the only thing keeping her heart inside of her
"Guilmon..." She looked over at the collapsed building.
Renamon ran over there
She dug through the piles of cement hoping to find her crush.
Then Renamon saw Guilmons tail
Her hands were bleeding from the sharp pieces of the building
Renamon kept digging. Then she found him.
He was badly hurt with deep cuts.
She dragged Guilmon out and checked his pluse...
He was still alive.
11112.title: The Fight

choices: Renamon has no choice but to find another digimon.
111121.content:
Renamon kisses Guilmon on the lips to see if anything would happen...
Then... Guilmon coughed out blood as his glistening eyes reflected off of the sun.
"Oh, my God! Guilmon, are you okay?"
"Re-- Renam-- mooooooooonnnnnn...."
She started to cry with her voice breaking up.
"GUILMON!"
No respond. His pulse was still recurring, though.
"What am I going to do now?!"
111121.title: Renamon kisses Guilmon to wake him up

choices: Ask Renamon to sit down and talk in the bedroom.
Stomach is growling, grab more food with Renamon.
1111212.content: After 5 minutes of panic, she was just about to give up, "I won't be able to tell him thank you..." she said to herself. A teardrop had fallen off her cheek, onto Guilmons face, and after a few seconds he began to move his head a little bit. Renamon looked at him as his head turned to her, "Your welcome...Renamon..." he said with all his strength. "GUILMON! Are you ok?" leaning up inches away from his face eyes bulging with surprise, hoping that he will be alright. "I...I'm still a bit hungry, but I think I'll make it." Renamon giggled and kissed his cheek. After a few days of caring for his wounds and getting some food, he had fully recovered. Guilmon wanted to thank her , for helping him recover...
1111212.title: A miracle happens.

choices: Renamon and Guilmon explore the city undisturbed
One of them sets off an alarm of some kind.
They are greeted by the only beings in the city. Mindless robots, built to serve
One or both discovered some hightly advanced technology and toy with it.
12.content:
A near picture-esq morning dawned over the dens Digital World jungle. Near perfect in that the momentary beauty of the morning is shattered by an echoing scream that rang through the jungle for a few miles, disturbing all creatures nearby in the process.

This was the scream of a particular red dinosaur waking up and finding a bug the size of his head three inches from the end of his nose.

Renamon was having a hard time not laughing as she disposed of the recently incinerated insect. "It's ok Guilmon," she called up to the twitching mass huddled in the lowest branches of the nearby tree, "I got rid of it, you can come down now."

The red and white dino looked reluctant as he slid to the ground, still looking around nervously as the sudden adrenaline rush made him quite twitchy for the moment. "You never told me there would be bugs that big on this trip."

Renamon shrugged as she started packing up the small camp they'd made, "I told you we'd be dealing with all sorts of wildlife, including big bugs."

"Yes, but you never said just HOW big." Guilmon persisted.

Renamon sighed and just let it slide as they finished packing up, shouldered their packs and pressed onward through the jungle, pausing every dozen yards or so to use an attack to clear away the thick vegetation to make a trail.

After a while, once Guilmon had calmed down, he tried for a more normal conversation, "Renamon, just what are we doing out here in the jungle anyway?"

"We're going on the basis of a legend," Renamon replied simply, "In an attempt to find a lost treasure."

"What sort of treasure?" Guilmon asked, "Because silver and gold I can take, even something like gemstones, but if it's something hokey like 'self-discovery' I'll be upset."

Renamon chuckled at that remark. "Well, I honestly don't know what the treasure is Guilmon. All I know is it's rumored that deep in this jungle lies an ancient city with untold value, many Digimon have searched, but while some came up empty handed, those who plunged the deepest depths of the jungle never returned."

"Ok," Guilmon huffed, "It's that kind of talk that makes me want to leave right now."

Guilmon turned as if to leave, but tripped on a root as he did so. Landing at the base of the nearby tree, it was even more startling when the ground gave way under him and he began to fall. Renamon barely saved her companion by grabbing hold of the tip of his tail just in the nick of time.

"Guilmon," She called, "Are you alright?"

"I think so," Came the slightly muffled reply as he dangled upside down in the hole, "But I think I hit my head. I'm seeing a faint light down a long tunnel..."

Five minuted later the pair were in the tunnel, Guilmon almost having been ungraciously dropped on his head thanks to Renamon start of surprise at hearing about the light. The pair proceeded down the tunnel and soon came upon an amazing site. The tunnel ended at a cliff that plunged downwards several hundred feet into a gigantic cavern. Above them the roots of old trees dangled like some sort of woven ceiling. But under that was truely incredible.

A vast domed city lay spread out before them. Easily ten miles wide from that they could see, almost reaching right up to the cave wall. Inside the dome, the city glowed with light, and every building was like some futuristic tower, curved and arching, full of all sorts of structural achievements that could not be made with crude efforts using wood or stone.

But for all it's wondrous design, there was something eery about it. Guilmon was the first to notice. "The city is empty," he breathed, almost afraid to hear his voice echo in the cave, "How is that possible Renamon? It looks like it was just built yesterday."

"I don't know," Renamon gave a cocky sort of smirk as she pulled a grappling hook from her pack, "But I intend to find out."

Another five minutes of tens repelling down the cliff face found them standing next to the city. It was creepy in a way. They stood on the edge of a perfectly manicured lawn, so uniform it looked like every blade of grass was the same length. And yet it stopped perfectly in line with the dome around it, leaving it to the rocky ground the pair stood on. This in itself might not have been unusual had the dome been solid, but when Guilmon reached out to touch the dome, his hand slid right through it. It was like a giant soap bubble almost, pushing through, while not as easy as walking in a room, was still far easier than trying to break through glass as one might assume the make of the dome.

Soon both were in the city and standing on the finely trimmed lawn. The more he looked around, the more Guilmon felt uneasy. There was a stillness in the air that was so thick it seemed almost as if severe pain would come to anyone who should break it. The air too smelled funny. Fresh and pure, but also tinged with the faintest smell of metal, as if it, like the city, had been manufactured.
12.title: Machu Picchu it Ain't

choices: The Robots take them to different floors and different appartments
The Robots take them to the top floor and one huge appartment for them both.
123.content:
Renamon and Guilmon had barely taken ten steps into the city when they heard a loud buzzing noise approaching, as if a swarm of bees was approaching. This was not the case though, as in the distance they spotted a group of flying metallic objects approaching. Just when Renamon was getting ready to run, the objects began to slow and approached them before stopping just five feet away.

They were robots, that was clear, but they didn't look to be Digimon of any kind. Bronze in color, they had an oblong torso that extended up from a small glowing plate that seemed to give them the ability to hover. The backs of their hands seemed rounded as well, added to the wide brimmed dome shape on top of their heads, it could be presumed that the robots could curl up into a tight ball for easy storage. Their eyes were an emotionless blue that glowed with no visible signs of intelligence.

The robots attempted to speak, or so Renamon and Guilmon could only guess, as the noise they made sounded like a pack of wolves drowning in pudding. After a moment of silence the robots tried again, this time sounding like a robotic cat destroying a orchestra pit full of harps.

"What do they want from us?" Guilmon asked Renamon as he tried to withstand the noise.

A moment later the noise ceased and the Robots spoke in perfect English this time. "Welcome home masters." it said in a voice that seemed to almost have emotion, but not quite. "We trust your journey has been rewarding."

Guilmon and Renamon looked at eachother in confusion.

"Please come," the robot continued, "Your quarters have been prepared and cleaned to perfection."

With the group of half a dozen robots surrounding them now, Renamon shrugged and started walking with Guilmon close behind. No matter the pace it seemed, the robots stayed the same distance ahead or behind them. Eventually, as they pushed deeper into the city, they came to the tallest building in the exact center. The lead robot extended one of it's fingers into a key-like slot and the doors opened.

Upon entering, both Digimon could that lobby, if that's what it was, was sparsely decorated with a large metallic desk along one wall and several metal chairs on the other. The creepy thing was everything was almost too perfect. As the Robots continued to lead them to some sort of elevator, both Renamon and Guilmon wondered what sort of wird place they had discovered.
123.title: Robots.

choices: Renamon tries to get into it. Later that night...
Renamon tries to get into it. The next day...
1232.content:
Both Digimon marveled as the doors opened on a simply gigantic penthouse suit. The whole thing was one gigantic room, easily as wide as the whole building. The walls were a tangerine coloring and the floors were carpeted with a thick tan colored wall-to-wall rug. Probably the oddest thing about the room though was its features. It held two gigantic beds on either side of the room facing each-other, each looking big enough to have a game of tennis on.

At right angles to both of the beds were two large in-ground baths, already steaming with warm water. And to add to the odd set up, in each of the four corners of the room, were corner kitchens, each corning having a fridge, stove, and preparation area. And in each seemed to be a squat robot wearing a chefs hat already preparing food.

"All for you masters," The lead robot said ushering them into the huge room.

Guilmon couldn't stop from ginning ear to ear. "Renamon, I think we've hit the jackpot." he smiled, "These robots think we're their masters and want to wait on us hand and foot."

Renamon looked a bit unsure as she glanced around the room though. "Are you sure that's a good idea Guilmon?" she asked as she tried to ignore the nearest robot preparing what looked to be her favorite meal of chicken and rice, "I mean, what if they turn on us or something? This room could be a elaborately disguised jail-cell for all we know."

"Ah get over it Renamon," Guilmon smiled stripping off his few clothes and sliding into the nearest bath, "If it looks bad we'll fight our way out, it's that simple."

Renamon looked unsure as she glanced back at the elevator doors which seemed to be flanked by two more robots. Both offline it looked like, but it was hard to tell.
1232.title: Lap of Luxury

choices: Yes. Renamon tries to eat less but the robots seem upset somehow.
No. The food is too good and the robots have more pleasure in store for the pair
12322.content:
Renamon settled in that evening with a sigh, the soft bed sheets feeling like nothing she'd ever experienced before. Practically like sleeping on a silken cloud.
         The afternoon has been quite luxurious. Both she and Guilmon had enjoyed the warm pools immensely, soft water jets playing over their bodies the whole time, relaxing every muscle like a deep massage. Before long both had been brought food by the robotic staff. Chicken, rice, and steamed vegetables for Renamon and what looked to be a small bakery's worth of bread and bucket of peanut butter for Guilmon. Both ended up eating as they lounged about.
         Renamon had told herself she should get up, explore, look around, plan possible escape routes... But every time she got up the urge the water just felt too good to leave. The servants even lowers a device made of four huge TVs, two facing the opposing beds and two he far ends of the tubs. From there they gave the pair controllers so Guilmon and Renamon could play video games.
         Renamon had watched Rika play some but have never really had time for games herself. Guilmon on the other hand was slightly more experienced. Pulling up a FPS Guilmon and Renamon made their selections. It took the first five kills from Guilmon before Renamon began to get the hang of it. After they'd gamed for a bit and their meals digested the robots brought more food for both of them. Renamon picked at it somewhat but Guilmon stuffed his face once more.
         After about twenty rounds the pair tried another game, this time racing. Again Renamon lost for a while until she got the hang of the controls, but she soon was beating Guilmon with ease. After that came a fighting game and more snacks from the robots. Now Renamon was in her element.
         It still took a couple losses before she got the hang of the controls, but she soon was beating Guilmon with ease.After that came a big dinner as both agreed to just watch a movie while they relaxed. When it had ended and both had sampled some desert, the pair were helped out of the pools by the robots, toweled off, and then tucked into bed.
         Renamon groaned a little, feeling her stomach stretched with so much food she hadn't intended to eat, the round bulge making it seem like she'd swallowed a basketball. Distantly on the opposite bed she could make out Guilmon who seemed to be sporting an even larger bulge and yet was snoozing soundly.
         Renamon rolled over with a sigh and tried to get some sleep. She made a promise to herself as she dozed off, she would eat less the next day and exercise more, but could she keep it?
12322.title: Reflections on Relaxation. (Or RnR)

choices: Follow the boy. He might need some help.
Guilmon notices something strange on the ground.
125.content:
Renamon knelt down, running her paw through the grass, it felt real and looked recently cut, but without the smell that always staid with cut grass. "This place is weird it looks like someones been maintaining it, but I can't hear or smell a living soul. Can you?" Guilmon shook his head walking over to the edge of the lawn and looking over the wall that surrounded the lawn they were on. "I guess we should look around eh. Maybe we'll find that treasure you heard about."

They left the small yard and began walking down what could loosely be called a road. It wasn't paved but was instead made of the same strange and slightly ceramic material the buildings were made of. As they neared an intersection Guilmon paused and tapped his claw against a building wall. The noise it produced was slightly harmonic, almost like a bell or something. "What is this stuff." Asked Guilmon, a note of awe in his voice as he played a short tune on the wall. Renamon stiffened slightly then pressed her paw against the wall, muffling the noise, and motioned for Guilmon to be quite. She looked up the road and waited a moment. "What is it?" whispered Guilmon. "Shhh, someone's coming." She replied, clamping her hand over his mouth.

True to her word a moment later a young boy went running by, he was clad in blue armor and had a head of spiky brown hair. Barely had he left then a bunch of squat robots with a single glowing eye came bustling in then out again, pursuing the blue armored boy. After the strange procession had left Renamon released her grip on Guilmon, who gasped for air, his face slightly tinged blue. Renamon walked over to the corner and peaked round both ways. "Should we follow them? He may need help, and at the very least he might be able to tell us something about this place." She glanced back at Guilmon who was leaning against the wall trying to catch his breath. Renamon smiled apologetically. "Sorry Guilmon. Too tight?" Guilmon growled "C'mon lets go. And next time let me keep you from breathing."

Guilmon walks up to the center of the crossing with Renamon and looks both ways. "So should we follow them or look around somewhere else?"
125.title: Seeing the Sights

choices: Do the right thing, help him, then find out about this machine.
1251.content:
"I think we should follow him. You up for it?" asked Renamon staring at the path the boy had been chased down. Guilmon laughed "You know me, always up for a fight." And with that they both took off in the direction the boy had run

After a short dash they rounded a corner and nearly bumped into one of the robot things. It immediately turned towards them and made a grating, electronic noise that definitely did not sound friendly. Guilmon reacted first hitting it hard with he's claws and yelling rock breaker. The robot was knocked back, flipping over and exploding upon impact with the wall.

Guilmon covered his head with his arm as small bits of it came raining down. "Well that was easy." He said grinning at Renamon who plucked a few pieces of metal from her fur. Renamon looked over his shoulder, her face paling slightly. "What is it." Asked Guilmon, looking behind himself to see over thirty of the things. All staring at them with those glowing red eyes. "Umm. Should we run?" Asked Guilmon. As one all the robots tilted backwards revealing a black hole at their base. Guilmon took a step back, then as if taking that as a signal all the Robots shot out large balls of spinning fire. Guilmon and Renamon dodged back around the corner as the torrent of fire burst from the alley. "Yes Guilmon. I think we should run." Renamon replied. "C'mon, back the way we came." She said pointing in the direction they had come from.

No sooner than they pushed off the wall than another group of robots had slid out of the alley opposite them, cutting off their escape route. "Dammit!" cursed Renamon turning to face the robots that appeared from the original alley, completely surrounding them. "So, fight our way out?" Asked Guilmon standing back to back to her. "Well, it's either try or die I suppose."Said Renamon. Both digimon took up fighting stances as the robots tilted backwards ready to fire. Suddenly a line of robots exploded as they where hit by small balls of red energy. Both the digimon looked up to the top of one of the shorter buildings to see the boy in blue armor shooting a arm mounted gun into the crowd of robots. Renamon and Guilmon nodded to each other and then dashed into the crowd destroying robots with their power paw and rock breaker attacks.

Soon the Robots where reduced to a smoking mound of scrap and the boy leapt down from his position and walked towards them. Guilmon stepped forward his claw extended. "Thanks for the help. Do you live round here?" The young boy accepted the offered claw and shook it firmly. "Your welcome. My names Megaman Volnutt, and I should really thank you. Those reaverbots have been chasing me for ages." Renamon stepped up next to Guilmon. "So those things are called reaverbots then. Why where they attacking you. Your not a digimon are you?" Megamon shrugged. "I'm a digger, I go around to ruins looking for power sources called refractors. Needless to say they are valuable and protected by the robots that we just destroyed. So that's my story, what's yours?" Asked Megaman.

This time Guilmon answered "Our names are Renamon and Guilmon. We were looking for treasure in the forest above when we, well, I fell into an entrance and, here we are." Megaman nodded then turned towards a large tower that was roughly central to the city. "I did some reseach on this city before I came. As well as having a large refractor they posses an advanced machine that can change the physical properties of anything. Such as gold from anything from wood or whatever. would you be interested in helping me get the refractor in exchange for my services to get to the machine.

A glint passed through Renamons eyes. "Excuse us a second Megaman." She said as she pulled Guilmon aside. "We should help him. He helped us after all." Said Guilmon. "Your right, but this refractor thing sounds valuable as well." They both glance at Megaman who is inspecting his gun arm.
1251.title: Battles and Introductions

choices: A large robotic dog leaps out and attacks them
Nothing but darkness is within. Pretty anticlimactic really.
12511.content:
They both turned back to Megaman and Renamon replied "You've got a deal. Lets go." Megaman nodded and motioned along the road towards the tower. "This way." Then began running along the road. A light tinkling coming from their claws against the roads surface. As they got closer to the Tower they noticed that a few walls seemed to be knocked down and a building was totally destroyed. Megaman stopped suddenly and held up his hand. Signalling them to stop.

"What is it?" Asked Renamon, not sensing any danger. "Something is wrong around here. Generally the Reaverbots are programed to not damage the city they protect but this looks like it was done by a big one. We should be on our guard." Guilmon laughed "C'mon we can take whatever this place throws at us." He took a step forward and was suddenly thrown from his feet as a huge robot burst from the ruins of a building. The Robot turned towards their group, raising the huge club like appendages attached to its arms. It's single red eye glowing with malevolence. "Watch out!" Yelled Megaman as he jumped away from the robot as it slammed it's arms against the ground. Causing a large explosion which knocked everyone against nearby walls.

"Guilmon does the term be careful even register for you?" Asked Renamon as she got up and launched herself at the attacking robot. Guilmon chuckled to him self and did likewise "Nope. Why do you ask." Guilmon said as he ducked under a clumsy swing and launched a fireball at the smoking hole Megaman had made a second before. This caused a small chain of explosions which linked up with another series that Renamon had caused on it's back. Everyone backed away quickly as the explosions increased in violence and engulfed the mechanical warrior.

As the explosion cleared several diamond like objects fell to the ground. Megaman stepped forward and crouched to gather them up. Renamon and Guilmon moved closer to try and see what they were. Megaman stood up and held out his diamond filled hands to Guilmon. "These are refractors. Small ones of course but they should be able to power the machine I was telling you about when we find it." Guilmon took the crystals and held them up to the light. They sparkled brilliantly, blue and purple in colour. "Are they valuable?" Asked Renamon. "These ones aren't worth much, but the larger ones can fetch a fair bit." Replied Megaman as he turned and continued along the path. Guilmon put the refractors in his backpack and followed suit while Renamon looked at the wreckage of the reaverbot. Just that handful of gems had powered that huge robot. No wonder bigger ones must be valuable. she shook herself out of it and ran to catch up to the other.

As she caught up they were entering a courtyard that lead to the front of the tower. Guilmon noticed that here to, the lawn was perfectly manicured. "Megaman, do you know where the people who built this city are? This place looks like it was made yesterday." Asked Guilmon. Megaman glanced up at the ceiling. "I have no idea who lived here or where they went. There are places like this all over the worlds. But as far as I know it's the reaverbots that keep the place from falling into disrepair." Megaman walked up to the front door. Which was completely smooth and featureless, save for a panel next to it. He was about to enter something on the keypad when he hesitated and looked at them both. "Be careful it's likely there will be a guard inside, trying to stop people from stealing stuff." Guilmon and Renamon nodded and stepped away from the door getting ready to react to anything. Megaman nodded back and pressed a botton on the panel.

Slowly the door way slid silently open. Whats inside?
12511.title: Partnership and Problems

125111.content:
A large and dark shape burst forth, head butting Guilmon in the chest and knocking Megaman down with it's tail. Renamon dashed forward, teleported behind it, launching a flurry of sharp diamonds at the base of the creatures neck. It stumbled to the ground and thrashed a bit. 15221.content:
A flash of gold among a sea of green, Renamon effortlessly bounded from bough to bough, heading ever onward. The fox Digimon had been exploring further and further across the digital world as of late, but something about this forest drew her in. The calling seemed even stronger the further she went, something tickling at the back of her mind almost like a half heard whisper. The thick canopy above meant that very little light reached below the thick cover, and what little there was tinged green. Ahead though there was a blindingly bright wall of light, it almost hurt to look upon it, but that seemed to be where she was being called so Renamon plunged on. When her eyes finally adjusted, she saw that it was a clearing in the midst of the forest, and within the clearing rose an enormous building.

Coming to a stop on one of the few tree limbs to extend into the clearing, the fox looked over what she had been apparently called to. Made entirely of what seemed to be gleaming crystal, the building caught the sunlight and refracted it in every direction. Four spindly towers were placed one apiece around a massive dome that rose nearly as tall as the towers around it. Markings covered the curving surface of the dome, none of which Renamon could recognize. The calling nagged at the back of her mind, urging her on, but something about this location caused the normally cool and collected fox to resist and want to back away. The air smelled wrong and it was too quiet compared to the noise of the forest behind her.

Step after step, she forced herself back towards the cover of the forest. The calling seemed to respond to her unwillingness, becoming a howl that ripped through the back of her mind. She suddenly found herself down on the ground cradling her head before the vast crystalline wall rising far above her and curving in every direction away from her. The fox started to move away from the wall when a spot of darkness marred the otherwise perfection of the wall. That spot quickly grew into a tunnel bored through the crystal. Despite the light streaming through the crystal everywhere else, the tunnel was pitch black just a few steps inside.

Her fur bristled and she tried to resist, but she found that her body seemed beyond her control now, walking stiffly towards the yawning darkness. Once she was several steps in, the light from outside started to fade. She managed to get a slight glimpse over her shoulder as the “door” irised shut plunging her into complete and utter darkness. Whatever was controlling her seemed to release her body, but it did little good, she couldn’t find the door behind her nor the walls of the tunnel that should have been there. It was almost as she was plunged into a featureless void except for how the smooth floor was still beneath her feet, granting her the sense that at least she wasn’t floating in absolute nothingness. A sudden brightness overwhelmed her, blindingly bright after the darkness, so it took some time before she was able to see what she had gotten into.

Eventually he made it though and leaping the last couple feet he flopped belly first on the sandy cave floor. As he got up and started brushing himself off, he noticed that the sand didn't seem to want to come off him. Shrugging it off, since the sand didn't itch or anything, Guilmon just figured he'd take a bath at the next river or whatever.

Needless to say, this was worrysome and Guilmon scanned his whole body to find the same thing. Every bit of him was vaguely see through. And not only that, his body had a sort of shine his scales shouldn't have had after such a dusty trip. Speaking of which, the sand that had covered his belly seemed to be gone and he rubbed his front, feeling his hand squeak faintly against his jiggling middle.
Guilmon just stood there for a long moment, thinking about this. He knew it had to be that thing he swallowed, but despite being see through, the object seemed to have vanished from his stomach.
Finally he came to a decision. Shrugging his shoulder he started off across the sands in the direction he'd been heading. He reasoned that there was no reason to panic just yet. He may have been changed physically, but he was still the same more or less. And even if this new development proved to be problematic, there was nothing he could do now save find civilization. Panicking would solve nothing.
So the lizard walked.
And walked.
And walked...
About mid-afternoon or so (hard to say since the sun never really set until night fall), Guilmon had to stop for a break. All the long walking had been wearisome on the poor dino and he wiped his brow despite not being able to sweat. He placed his clawed hands against the ground to steady himself, and for the second time that day he was surprised since his hands were on the ground and he was still upright.
Looking down, Guilmon let out a small yelp of surprise. Below his waste his legs had vanished into a pile of red jell, looking behind him he could see his tail surrounded by a small pool of the jell as well, though thankfully there was none to be seen beyond, which at least told him he hadn't lost any of himself.
Still it was disturbing to see his legs gone completely. A memory came to mind though of a Jello mold he'd had with his tamer once. On a hot dy the jello had melted into something less solid. Guilmon could only guess that with his new form, the heat of the desert was doing that to his new dessert-like body.
Looking around, he spotted some more rocks about a hundred yards away. Angling for them, Guilmon began to move again. How he was able to move with no legs, he wasn't sure, but he had to keep going. He had almost melted to his chest before he made it into the cool of the shade and he sat back to relax. As he looked over the jell that was his body, he wished his legs were back, and the more he thought about it, the more he wanted it. And, amazingly, as his body began to cool once more, the jell that had been trailing behind him began to solidify again into his familiar limbs.

The day found Renamon in a particularly miserable spot. Lost in the depths of a dark forest in the Digital World, the yellow vixen had beens tumbling around for days, weak from lack of food and lack of sleep due to the seemingly endless cold rain that poured down. Occasionally she found a dry patch under a big tree to rest for a while, but the cold wind took her breath away with every hard gust piercing her drenched fur coat.
         She couldn't go on. Hunger and weariness were taking their toll.
         Spotting another large tree as she trudged forwards Renamon curled up in a small notch in the side of it. Is this really how it ends? she thought darkly, A life spent fighting to get strong finding friends, having a home and a... family. And now I loose to the very nature of the Digital World? How pathetic...
         Looking up at the dark sky barely visible through the tree branches she sighed and spoke allowed. "They say the Digi Gnomes grant wishes of humans, but do they listen to the actual Digimon?"
         With a sigh she shook her head and looked skywards again, "If I could have a wish, it would be to have a way to solve all my problems. I wish I had a way to have everything I lost or need and then some. I don't care if it sounds greedy, right now I want what I deserve for all I've been through."
         Of course Renamon was sounding greedy and she knew it, but after slogging through the cold rain and being wet, hungry, and miserable for days it was understandable she'd about had enough. As she leaned back against the tree though, there was a sudden crack and with a yelp Renamon, too tired to react in time, fell backwards and down a muddy slope into the dark depths of an underground chamber.
         With a groan Renamon tried to brush some of the muck from her eyes and face groaning as she felt herself absolutely covered in the muddy mess. As her keen eyes looked around for any method of getting out, she spotted a strange glow, carefully standing up and finding she had the head room to do so, Renamon tried to find the source of the strange lavender glow that filled the chamber.
         As it turned out it was right over her head in the shape of a strange pendent hanging off a golden chain that dangled from the tree roots. The pendent itself was shaped like a flower with a strange blue gemstone set in the center the size of a circle formed between the thumb an forefinger touching fingertips.
         Spotting some writing on the back of the pendent, Renamon carefully pulled it down and tried to read it in the dim light.
         " 'Wishes small and wishes grand, help to shape the Digital Land. Anything you want and more, but remember be careful what you wish for.' " Renamon blinked turning the pendent over, "A wishing amulet? Anything I want?"
         It seemed too good to be true, which normally would have been exactly the case, but in the digital world anything was possible, So with some minor hesitation, Renamon slipped the chain over her neck and let the pendent rest over her chest ruff of fur. The pendent flashed brightly for a moment and then dimmed somewhat.
         "Well, might as well test it. But what to wish for?"

info.brief_description: Choose Renamon and/or Guilmon and do anything you want to them
info.description:
This is a 'anything goes' story. Renamon, Guilmon, and others can have almost anything happen to them. But there are some rules:

1. Keep the focus on Renamon and/or Guilmon. New characters may appear, but those two are the focus of the story.

2. No one sentence paragraphs. I reserve the right to delete or edit any posts I deem too short or utterly unintelligible.

3. No human sex. If your going to bring in humans for adult moments (or at all really), they need to be transformed into Digimon through some sort happenstance.

4. Always give an out. In every chapter always list at least two options for the characters to take, either with the path you want or out of it. No change need be permanent.

5. No death or gore. If any character pops or something, they will do so like a balloon and return to normal in time.

6. Pregnancy, should it come up, will only be with Digi-eggs, and of those, if any have to hatch for the story, keep it as few as possible.

7. Try to follow one theme, don't go from one theme to another without giving an explanation. Changes may stack, like macro growth and weight gain, but do not just suddenly stop one to start another.

8. Watersports, scat, and other such gross instances are completely out. Not one instance of them or the chapter will be deleted. I will tolerate some minor slob (belching, farting, a dusting of crumbs or other debris covering a body) but don't make it the main focus of a story. And always allow the option of the character getting cleaned up in a followup chapter.
